title: Shakira to Bring New Life to â€˜Pies Descalzosâ€™ & â€˜Oral Fixationâ€™ With Spotify AnniversaryÂ Special
summary: The Colombian artist honors 20 and 30 years these iconic LPs with a Spotify-exclusive EP, featuring Ed Sheeran and special stories.
body: Shakira is gearing up for a major celebration honoring her legendary career with a special edition of Spotify Anniversary. To mark the 30th anniversary of Pies Descalzos and the 20th anniversary of Oral Fixation Vol. 1 and Vol. 2, the global superstar is releasing reimagined versions of some of her most iconic hits exclusively on Spotify on Wednesday (Oct 22). The five-track EP will feature newly recorded versions of beloved songs, â€œPies Descalzos, SueÃ±os Blancos,â€ â€œAntologÃ­a,â€ â€œLa Pared,â€ â€œDÃ­a de Enero,â€ and a reimagining of â€œHips Donâ€™t Lie,” featuring Ed Sheeran and Colombian star BeÃ©le . As part of the Spotify Anniversary series, the artist also “reflects, discusses the impact, and shares never-before-told stories about the creation of the iconic albums,” says the press release. According to statistics provided to Billboard EspaÃ±ol , the original 1995 and 2005 albums have collectively surpassed 6.1 billion global streams, with over 955 million coming from U.S. listeners alone. Following Shakira’s 2020 Super Bowl performance, Pies Descalzos saw a 117% spike in weekly global Spotify streams, while Oral Fixation experienced an even greater surge, rising by â€¦

title: Bob Mosesâ€™ New Album Is About Growing Up: â€˜We Started As Kids, and Now We Both HaveÂ Kidsâ€™
summary: The duo's fourth studio album, Blink, is out today (Oct. 17) via AWAL.
body: Bob Moses are searching for something few get to achieve: a lifelong career in music. That might not have seemed obvious when the Vancouver-born electronic duo of Jimmy Vallance and Tom Howie were igniting dance floors at Brooklyn raves in the early 2010s. Now, theyâ€™re thinking a lot about what it means to be an adult. â€œWe started as kids, and now we both have new kids, so that gives us an interesting snapshot on the passing of time. Thereâ€™s lots to look back on,â€ says Howie before the intimate Billboard Canada LIVE Q&A and performance at the W Toronto at the end of September. â€œWeâ€™ve had these highs that we used to dream about, but thereâ€™s still this element of feeling the same as we did when we were 16 in our bedrooms first wanting to make music.â€ Related Watch Bob Moses Perform a Sunset Show From LA’s Iconic Griffith Observatory 'Godspeed, Ace': Ace Frehley Mourned by KISS Bandmate Gene Simmons, Bret Michaels, Tom Morello, Pearl Jam & More Ace Frehley of KISS Will Become Only the Third Person to Receive a Posthumous Kennedy Center Honor The pairâ€™s debut album, 2015â€™s  Days Gone By  and 2018 followup  Battle Lines  were both chart â€¦

title: Donnie McClurkin Talks Recording Final Studio Album & New Single â€˜Better Afterwhileâ€™: â€˜I Wanted to Help EncourageÂ Everybodyâ€™
summary: Donnie McClurkin tells Billboard about his new song, and about plans for his final recorded album FINALLY!, out next year.
body: Since first rising as a solo artist with his 1996 self-titled debut project, Donnie McClurkin has invigorated and redefined Gospel and worship music with songs such as â€œI Call You Faithful,â€ â€œWait on the Lordâ€ (with Karen Clark Sheard), â€œStandâ€ and â€œGreat Is Your Mercy.â€ Along the way, heâ€™s earned 10 Stellar Awards and two BET Awards. Now the triple Grammy winner is stepping away from recording music, but not without a final goodbye. â€œBetter Afterwhile,â€ the first song from McClurkinâ€™s upcoming final recorded project, comes out today (Oct. 17). “It’s a byproduct of the times that we’re living in,â€ McClurkin tells Billboard of the song. â€œI just wanted to help encourage everybody that no matter how bad times are, itâ€™s going to get better after a while. Nothing remains the same and the different situations that we’re going through as a nation and a world, there needs to be some kind of encouragement to let them know that we’ve been through hard times before and we made it through.â€ McClurkinâ€™s new song previews FINALLY! , McClurkinâ€™s last studio album and first since 2016â€™s The Journey . The set, recorded at TBN Studios in Hendersonville, Tennessee, willâ€¦

title: Inside the Hollywood Real Estate â€˜Boondoggleâ€™ at the Center of Calvin Harrisâ€™ FraudÂ Claims
summary: CMNTY Culture Campus was originally thought up to ease tax liabilities on a $90 million catalog sale. Now, itâ€™s the subject of a legal fight with the EDM superstar.
body: In 2020, Philip Lawrence needed money. Though the songwriter had forged a successful career collaborating with Bruno Mars , he had depleted his finances and was about to have his catalog seized. So, he hired Thomas St. John, an entertainment industry business manager, to get things in order.   St. John helped stave off seizure and negotiated the sale of Lawrenceâ€™s catalog for $90 million. But he also went into business with the songwriter on a Hollywood real estate project called CMNTY Culture Campus, originally pitched by Lawrenceâ€™s lawyers to defer and reduce capital gains taxes from the catalog sale.  Related Calvin Harris Accuses His Financial Adviser of $22M Theft: â€˜Absolutely Breached That Trustâ€™ 'VIBE' Is Joining Forces With 'Rolling Stone' Solange Appointed First Scholar-in-Residence at USC Thornton School of Music Now, CMNTY Culture is the subject of bombshell fraud claims filed against St. John by another one of his clients, the EDM superstar Calvin Harris â€” while St. John’s company has filed for bankruptcy. Billboard dove into court records to investigate how a group of music professionals ended up involved in a real estate â€¦

title: From Labubus to â€˜KPop Demon Huntersâ€™ â€“ Where to Shop Last Minute Halloween Pop Culture Costumes for $60 andÂ Under
summary: Here's where to shop timely costumes without breaking the bank.
body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. Are you searching for the perfect pop culture costumes ahead of Halloween, but don’t want to spend a fortune? Well, you’re in the right place. Here at ShopBillboard , we believe in a bargain. There’s no sense in emptying your pockets for a costume you might only wear once. In the spirit of frugality and with Halloween almost upon us, we’ve taken the liberty of rounding up a few costumes for both men and women that reference some of the most influential pop culture moments of 2025, in our humble opinion. The best part? All of these costumes are sure to come in time for Halloween if you buy them now. We’re talking Wicked , Wednesday , Squid Game and so much more. These costumes are not only affordable, but high-quality to boot with multiple four-to-five star ratings and hundreds of reviews. Keep reading to shop our picks for pop culture Halloween costumes for $60 and under below. Disguise 'Minecraft' Bee Dress Costume forâ€¦

title: 5 Best Moments of Laufeyâ€™s â€˜A Matter of Timeâ€™ Tour at New York Cityâ€™s Madison Square Garden: â€˜Hamilton,â€™ PinkPantheress &Â More
summary: The jazz-pop superstar brought endless whimsy to The Garden for her second night at the iconic NYC arena. Get all the details.
body: Hand-wringing and histrionically complaining about the quality of music for younger audiences has become a generational rite of passage, but if Laufey ‘s arena-conquering A Matter of Time Tour is anything to go by, late Gen Z and Gen Alpha have stars of their own who are proudly carrying the jazz and vocal pop mantles into a new era of Top 40. Commencing on Sept. 15 at Orlando’s Kia Center, Laufey’s latest trek touched down at Crypto.com Arena in Los Angeles on Sept. 26 and will visit major cities across the U.S. and Europe before concluding on March 15, 2026, at KÃ³rinn Arena in her home country of Iceland. The tour is in support of her A Matter of Time album, which reached No. 4 on the Billboard 200 and topped both Jazz Albums and Independent Albums. After her last LP, Bewitched , won her a Grammy for best traditional pop vocal album and spawned an unlikely hit single in “From the Start,” Laufey was tasked with scaling up her vision and output to match her ever-widening audience. To bring it all to life onstage, the classically trained multi-instrumentalist, vocalist and songwriter fashioned her latest LP’s particularly hooky songs into a whollâ€¦

title: 6 Balletcore Pieces to Shop from Tinasheâ€™s Urban OutfittersÂ Collection
summary: The collab with Urban Outfitters features apparel and accessories for both men and women.
body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. If there’s one thing that Tinashe is a pro at, it’s dancing. Of course, she’s also mastered singing, what with hits such as “2 On” and “No Broke Boys,” but her dancing prowess is just as impressive as her Billboard Hot 100-charting tracks. Tinashe started professionally training in dance at the age of four. In fact, the “Nasty” singer has extensive experience in several dance styles, including ballet, tap and jazz. With all that in mind, it makes sense why Tinashe brought her love of movement to a new collaboration with Urban Outfitters . The collection, aptly titled 1st Position, is available to shop right now at Urban Outfitters. You’ve got apparel and accessories for both men and women starting at just $19, all inspired by Tinashe’s love of dance, specifically ballet. These pieces are quintessential balletcore vibes mixed with a touch of street-style swagger. It’s a reflectioâ€¦

title: Angela Aguilar, Gloria Estefan, Lenny TavÃ¡rez, Enrique Bunbury & More Celebrate Songwriting at LaÂ Musa
summary: The 12th annual edition of the Latin Songwriters Hall of Fame award was a heartfelt affair.
body: The 12th annual La Musa Awards, presented by the Latin Songwriters Hall of Fame, took place this year at the Flamingo Theater in Downtown Miami on Thursday (Oct. 16). The venueâ€™s intimacy, coupled with a more informal, speakeasy vibe, permeated an award ceremony that was notable for its moments of laughter and easy congeniality. It was also notable for its star power. Those in attendance included Gloria and Emilio Estefan, with Gloria presenting the La Musa Founders Award to Mike Oâ€™Neill, president and CEO of BMI and a major supporter of Latin music, who Gloria praised for his â€œgenuine heart and unwavering dedication.â€ Alex GonzÃ¡lez, drummer for Mexican rock band ManÃ¡, introduced new inductee Enrique Bunbury, the eclectic Spanish rocker. Angela Aguilar gave a heartfelt speech accepting the La Musa Elena Casals award, and Lenny TavÃ¡rez, the reggaetÃ³n star whoâ€™s written major hits for many different artists, confessed that just a year ago, heâ€™d sat in the audience yearning for an award. He accepted the La Musa Triunfador award from producer Sergio George. As La Musa cofounder Rudy PÃ©rez noted, George was one of three producers present that evening who made it onto the Top Producers â€¦

summary: The global cholera statistics for 2024, shows an increase in both the number of people who fell sick and died from the disease.
